puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: Which parable is this: 'A man sold all he had to buy one pearl'?
puzzles.explanation: This parable, found in Matthew 13:45-46, illustrates the immense value of the Kingdom of Heaven.

puzzles.title: Bible Trivia
puzzles.question: Who built the ark?
puzzles.explanation: Noah was instructed by God to build an ark to save his family and a pair of every living creature from the Great Flood (Genesis 6-9).

puzzles.title: Bible Trivia
puzzles.question: How many days and nights did it rain during the Great Flood?
puzzles.explanation: Genesis 7:12 states that the rain fell on the earth for forty days and forty nights.

puzzles.title: Parable Challenge
puzzles.question: In the Parable of the Sower, what do the seeds represent?
puzzles.explanation: In the Parable of the Sower (Matthew 13, Mark 4, Luke 8), Jesus explains that the seeds represent the Word of God.

puzzles.title: Bible Characters
puzzles.question: Who was swallowed by a great fish?
puzzles.explanation: The prophet Jonah was swallowed by a great fish after trying to flee from God's command to go to Nineveh (Book of Jonah).

puzzles.title: New Testament
puzzles.question: Which disciple denied Jesus three times?
puzzles.explanation: Before the rooster crowed, Peter denied knowing Jesus three times, as foretold by Jesus (Matthew 26:69-75).

puzzles.title: Old Testament
puzzles.question: Who led the Israelites out of Egypt?
puzzles.explanation: Moses was chosen by God to lead the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt and through the wilderness to the promised land (Book of Exodus).

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: What was the name of the garden where Adam and Eve lived?
puzzles.explanation: The Garden of Eden is described in the Book of Genesis as the place where God placed Adam and Eve.

puzzles.title: Bible Proverbs
puzzles.question: Complete the proverb: 'Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a ____.'
puzzles.explanation: This proverb is found in Proverbs 16:18.

puzzles.title: Miracles of Jesus
puzzles.question: Which miracle involved Jesus walking on water?

options.3: Walking on the Sea of Galilee

puzzles.explanation: After feeding the five thousand, Jesus walked on the Sea of Galilee to meet his disciples who were in a boat (Matthew 14, Mark 6, John 6).

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: What was the first plague God sent upon Egypt?
puzzles.explanation: The first plague was when God turned all the water in Egypt, including the Nile River, into blood (Exodus 7:14-25).

puzzles.title: Bible Geography
puzzles.question: Where was Jesus born?
puzzles.explanation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea, as prophesied in the Old Testament (Matthew 2:1, Micah 5:2).

puzzles.title: Apostles
puzzles.question: Who was known as the 'doubting' disciple?
puzzles.explanation: Thomas famously doubted the resurrection of Jesus until he saw and touched Jesus' wounds (John 20:24-29).

puzzles.title: Book of Revelation
puzzles.question: What is the last book of the Bible?
puzzles.explanation: The Book of Revelation, also known as the Apocalypse of John, is the final book of the New Testament and thus the Christian Bible.

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: Who wrote most of the Psalms?
puzzles.explanation: King David is traditionally credited with writing many of the Psalms, though others contributed as well.

puzzles.title: Bible Stories
puzzles.question: Who fought Goliath?
puzzles.explanation: Young David, a shepherd boy, famously defeated the Philistine giant Goliath with a sling and a stone (1 Samuel 17).

puzzles.title: Parables
puzzles.question: What did the prodigal son demand from his father?
puzzles.explanation: The prodigal son demanded his share of the inheritance before leaving home and squandering it (Luke 15:11-32).

puzzles.title: Bible Law
puzzles.question: How many commandments did God give to Moses on Mount Sinai?
puzzles.explanation: God gave Moses the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai, which are foundational to Jewish and Christian law (Exodus 20).

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: Who betrayed Jesus for 30 pieces of silver?
puzzles.explanation: Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus' twelve disciples, betrayed Him for thirty pieces of silver (Matthew 26:14-16).

puzzles.title: Prophets
puzzles.question: Which prophet was thrown into a lion's den?
puzzles.explanation: Daniel was thrown into a lion's den for praying to God instead of the king, but God protected him (Daniel 6).

puzzles.title: Bible Heroes
puzzles.question: Who was known for his great strength, derived from his hair?
puzzles.explanation: Samson's strength was directly linked to his uncut hair, a Nazirite vow (Judges 16).

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: What did Jesus turn water into at the wedding in Cana?
puzzles.explanation: This was Jesus' first public miracle, performed at a wedding feast in Cana of Galilee (John 2:1-11).

puzzles.title: New Testament Figures
puzzles.question: Who was the first martyr of the Christian church?
puzzles.explanation: Stephen's martyrdom is recounted in Acts 7.

puzzles.title: Genesis Stories
puzzles.question: Who was Abraham's wife?
puzzles.explanation: Sarah was Abraham's wife and the mother of Isaac (Genesis 17:15-21).

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: What animal spoke to Balaam?
puzzles.explanation: Balaam's donkey miraculously spoke to him to prevent him from cursing the Israelites (Numbers 22:21-39).

puzzles.title: Beatitudes
puzzles.question: Complete the Beatitude: 'Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the ____.'
puzzles.explanation: This is the first Beatitude from Matthew 5:3.

puzzles.title: Bible History
puzzles.question: What city's walls fell after the Israelites marched around it for seven days?
puzzles.explanation: The walls of Jericho fell after the Israelites, led by Joshua, marched around the city as God commanded (Joshua 6).

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: Who was the mother of Jesus?
puzzles.explanation: Mary, the wife of Joseph, was the mother of Jesus (Matthew 1, Luke 1-2).

puzzles.title: Epistles
puzzles.question: Which apostle wrote the most books in the New Testament?
puzzles.explanation: The Apostle Paul wrote a significant portion of the New Testament, including many epistles (letters) to early Christian communities.

puzzles.title: Biblical Events
puzzles.question: What event is celebrated during Passover?
puzzles.explanation: Passover commemorates the liberation of the Israelite slaves from Egypt, specifically when the angel of death 'passed over' the homes of the Israelites (Exodus 12).

puzzles.title: Moral Dilemmas
puzzles.question: Is it ethical to lie to save a life?

options.3: It depends on the specific circumstances

puzzles.explanation: This is a classic ethical dilemma, often debated in moral philosophy, highlighting the complexities of consequentialism versus deontology.

puzzles.title: Famous Quotes
puzzles.question: Who said, 'The unexamined life is not worth living'?
puzzles.explanation: This profound statement is attributed to Socrates, emphasizing the importance of self-reflection and critical inquiry in living a meaningful life.

puzzles.title: Human Virtues
puzzles.question: Which of these is NOT traditionally considered one of the cardinal virtues?
puzzles.explanation: The four cardinal virtues are Prudence, Justice, Fortitude (Courage), and Temperance. Humility is often considered a theological virtue or a moral virtue, but not one of the cardinal four.

puzzles.title: Leadership Principles
puzzles.question: What leadership style involves leaders making decisions without much input from group members?
puzzles.explanation: An autocratic leadership style is characterized by individual control over all decisions and little input from group members.

puzzles.title: Personal Growth
puzzles.question: Which term describes the process of becoming the best version of oneself?
puzzles.explanation: Self-actualization is a concept in humanistic psychology, particularly associated with Abraham Maslow's hierarchy of needs.

puzzles.title: Community & Society
puzzles.question: What is the concept of acting for the well-being of others, often without expectation of reward?
puzzles.explanation: Altruism is the principle and moral practice of concern for happiness of other human beings or animals, resulting in a quality of life both material and spiritual.

puzzles.title: Ancient Wisdom
puzzles.question: In which ancient civilization did the concept of 'karma' originate?
puzzles.explanation: Karma is a central concept in Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism, all originating from the Indian subcontinent.

puzzles.title: Decision Making
puzzles.question: What cognitive bias describes the tendency to search for, interpret, favor, and recall information in a way that confirms one's preexisting beliefs?
puzzles.explanation: Confirmation bias leads individuals to seek out and interpret information in a way that supports their existing beliefs, often leading to a skewed perception of reality.

puzzles.title: Ethical Principles
puzzles.question: The 'Golden Rule' is best summarized as:

options.2: Treat others as you would like to be treated

puzzles.explanation: The Golden Rule is a moral principle that asks individuals to treat others as they would like to be treated themselves, promoting empathy and reciprocal respect.

puzzles.title: Daily Puzzle
puzzles.question: Which of these is a key component of effective communication?
puzzles.explanation: Active listening involves fully concentrating on what is being said rather than just passively hearing the message, which is crucial for effective communication.
